actions.committee: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
actions.subcommittee: Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce,  and the District of Columbia
actions.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce,  and the District of Columbia.
Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.committee: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia

official_title: A bill to provide that attorneys employed by the Department of Justice shall be eligible for compensatory time off for travel under section 5550b of title 5, United States Code.

summary.text: Makes attorneys employed by the Department of Justice (including assistant U.S. attorneys) eligible for compensatory time off for travel.

titles.title: A bill to provide that attorneys employed by the Department of Justice shall be eligible for compensatory time off for travel under section 5550b of title 5, United States Code.
